reviews.text: Business facilities are OK, rooms could do with updating yet staff are attentive and very very helpful. My main gripe is that during our stay the hotel was used by people that I can only describe as 'odd'. As soon as they had a drink in the evening noise levels went through the roof, this increased into the early hours as we were trying to sleep yet all we could hear were people rampaging through the corridors shouting out obscenities. A colleague went out to investigate what all the noise was about and all he could see were male guests wandering around obviously highly intoxicated. One guest was seen numerous times during the early hours just staggering around in search of someone. I would like to think that in future the DeVere group either have a more rigorous policy on serving alcohol or they turn away groups that contain undesirables.
reviews.title: Business trip ruined by other guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to book this hotel at the bargain rate of £29 a night; we have paid much more than that in this area for poor quality bed and breakfasts.
reviews.title: Good value for money if you get a deal, very helpful staff.
excellent hotel
reviews.text: The first room we were given was at the far end of the hotel, was very small, and wireless access did not work. We were moved next day to another room, which smelled of choked drains; another word with reception and manager and our final move was to a more spacious room, where the wifi worked. Hotel mainly caters for business meetings/training. It is only a few minutes drive to the centre of High Wycombe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the price we were more than satisfied; special thanks to Alana in reception and manager Shafeeq for their help.
reviews.title: very poor indeed

reviews.text: we arrived at the hotel at 9pm to find our booking had not gone through,not a problem at all within 5 minutes we were in our room which was lovely and clean and very warm,i put a heater in after reading other reviews which we didnt need,overall great value for money and we will be using it again
reviews.title: ...have seen better for less...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here to break our journey up to Canterbury. We got a rate of £19 in the De Vere sale so we really cannot moan. The location is beautiful and tranquil. We had a ground floor double room that had patio doors which opened out on to a gorgeous garden. The room was dated but the bed was comfy it had a large wardrobe, hairdryer, tea and coffee making facilities and the bathroom was fine. The shower was over the bath, good pressure and plenty of hot water. The tv was tiny and a small fridge would be handy. We did not eat here, the venue is more suitable for conferences so there was a large group in the restaurant. It also looked quite expensive but I cannot comment on the value. I found the staff really helpful and there is free wifi and a terminal in reception. The car park is a little walk from the rooms but I have walked further in other hotels. The hallways are open and the fact that they are tiled makes it quite noisy when people walk past or are wheeling cases. The hotel is in a remote location and is about a £7 taxi fare from High Wycombe station. As I said we really couldn't moan for £19 and we would stay again as it is very peaceful and a beautiful location but not really an upmarket get away.
reviews.title: Beautiful location but dated, more of a conference hotel, good value though

reviews.text: Looks very different to the pictures on line when you arrive which is a bit of a surprise - the local YMCA looked newer and in better condition. However, it is in a very picturesque location with pretty surroundings (lots of trees and flowers).
reviews.title: Not what you'd expect from the website...even if it is just £40/night.

reviews.text: The rooms were disappointing - very old fashioned, not particularly clean and generally disappointing. The TV was a tiny 14 inch hanging form the ceiling and although it was advertised as offering satellite, we only had 4 channels. The remote control had buttons missing and clearly hadn't been dusted for a while.
reviews.title: Conference centre not a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was similar standard. The shower seal was broken and so sprayed everywhere; the floor was dirty in places and we found a woodlouse and several bugs which was off-putting.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: The grounds were the best thing about this place (I wouldn't call it a hotel, it is more of a hostel). The tennis courts weren't in a good enough state to be used but the pitch and putt was great fun. The gym was well equipped for cardio and more spacious than I'd have expected.
reviews.title: All fur coat and no knickers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The worst part for me is if you're not an early riser, don't expect a lie in! The noise of people wheeling luggage along a tiled corridoor is deafening!
reviews.title: What to expect for 29 pounds?

reviews.text: Having read the previous reviews on this place we were not looking forward to our stay to say the very least! But we were presently surprised. Althought our room was not the most modern and up to date place we have ever stayed in, it was perfectly acceptable. The communal areas of the hotel were all nice, icluding the bar, which was i have to say very expensive. I think its fair to say that there is a fair amount of snobbery going on in earlier reviews, especially when for the most of the time you can book this place for £19 a night!
reviews.title: No where near as bad as we expected!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been to about six DeVere hotels in the last year and have been impressed with the really high standards of the rooms, restaurants and staff, so when we arrived at Uplands house we were very disappointed with the state of the place.
reviews.title: Dont go

reviews.text: The first room we were shown was no better than a hostel with dirty stained carpet etc and the second room was even worse!!! The restaurant looked like a works canteen, so we refused to stay and went home.
reviews.title: NICE HOTEL FOR SHORT STAY
DeVe Upland House Hotel "Horrible" dont go there...
reviews.text: They need to tear the whole lot down and start again!!!

reviews.title: Bedroom not in the actual hotel!
reviews.text: Several of my family stayed for a wedding near by and this was ideal. The rooms were basic but nice and clean. They would not serve food until after 2pm which was strange but there was a wedding there at the time. Good price for short stay.
